title: Europe needs to listen to the unusual suspects - E3G
summary: The article argues that Europe needs to accelerate its transition to a net-zero economy to maintain its technological leadership and competitiveness. To achieve this, the EU needs to make bold and rapid decisions, including a renewed focus on industrial policy, speeding up planning consent processes, and leveraging under-used savings to finance clean technology investments. However, to avoid past mistakes, Europe needs to make clear choices between technologies, address social impacts of the transition, and ensure public support for climate action.

title: Cosmetic 360: “The green transition is an innovation challenge” - Premium beauty
summary: The Cosmetic 360 show will focus on Cleantech innovations for the cosmetics and perfume industry, showcasing green technologies and sustainable practices. The event will feature conferences, an exhibition zone with startup presentations, and various workshops focusing on eco-responsible packaging, decarbonization, and bio-sourced ingredients. The show will also feature a dedicated area for perfumes and K Beauty.

title: Government of Canada announces $9.9 million to scale up B.C. technology businesses and improve productivity - Canada NewsWire
summary: The Canadian government is investing $9.9 million in the Integrated Marketplace, a program that helps B.C. tech companies develop and test green innovations in real-world environments like airports and seaports.  The program aims to help companies commercialize and export their products while reducing emissions and improving efficiency for large organizations.  The program has already launched testbeds at Vancouver International Airport, the Port of Prince Rupert, and now the Port of Vancouver.

title: Elemis partners with Morro to create upcycled single-use sachets for cosmetics - Premium beauty
summary: Elemis, a British skincare brand, is collaborating with Xampla, a clean technology start-up, to develop plant-based, plastic-free sachets for cosmetic products. The goal is to upcycle Elemis's plant waste into bio-based film that can replace single-use plastics. This project, supported by government funding, aims to provide an environmentally friendly alternative to plastic sachets, a popular format in the cosmetics industry.
product_or_process: plant-based, plastic-free sachets for cosmetic products

title: CICE Funds Innovation to Advance the Measuring, Monitoring, and Verification (MMV) of Carbon Management - Canada NewsWire
summary: The B.C. Centre for Innovation and Clean Energy (CICE) is awarding $2.82 million to four companies developing technologies to measure, monitor, and verify carbon emissions reduction, removal, and avoidance. This funding will help advance commercialization of solutions vital to the global carbon credit market and spur investment in emissions reduction programs and technologies. CICE's investment aims to support British Columbia's goal of becoming a leader in clean technology and a low-carbon economy.
